item.title: Bug Fables: The Everlasting Sapling version 1.2 update now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/bug-fables-the-everlasting-sapling-version-1-2-update-now-available

  • PC
  • PS4
  • Switch
  • Xbox One

Commemorating the adventure RPG's fifth anniversary.

Publisher Dangen Entertainment and developer Moonsprout Games have released the version 1.2 update for adventure RPG Bug Fables: The Everlasting Sapling in celebration of the game’s fifth anniversary, the companies announced.

The update adds the following content:

  • Fishing in The Fishing Village – Catch worms and reel in some fun!
  • New Post-Game Boss Fight – Face off against the heroes of legend in B.O.S.S. mode!
  • Team Up with Allies – Watch allies you support join you through a new special medal!
  • 11 New Medals – Expand your strategies with even more new gameplay-altering medals!
  • New Items to Discover – Scattered across the overworld, waiting for explorers to find.
  • One New Music Track – A brand-new addition to Bugaria’s already beloved soundtrack.
  • Quality-of-Life Tweaks
    • Vi’s Beemerang now has an option to lock angles to the nearest eight cardinal directions in battle.
    • A grace period added after falling droplets allows for easier freezing.
    • Various language fixes, minor balance and bug resolutions, and more!

“This update is a love letter to the incredible Bug Fables community,” DANGEN Enertainment said in a press release. “For those who have already journeyed through the world of Bugaria, this update offers a perfect excuse to return. And for newcomers, there has never been a better time to jump in and experience the award-winning adventure for the first time.”

Bug Fables: The Everlasting Sapling is available now for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam, GOG, and itch.io.

Watch a new trailer below.

Version 1.2 Update Trailer

item.title: RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic coming to Switch on December 5
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/rollercoaster-tycoon-classic-coming-to-switch-on-december-5

  • Switch

Currently available for PC, iOS, and Android.

Atari will release a Switch version of RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic on December 5, the publisher announced.

RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic previously launched for PC via Steam and GOG, as well as iOS via App Store and Google Play.

“Fans of RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic have been hoping for a Switch version and we are excited to bring it to the platform,” said Atari vice president of games publishing Ethan Stearns in a press release. “Our partners at Graphite Lab did an amazing job translating RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic’s detailed keyboard-based controls to controller input.”

Stearns continued, “Bringing RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic to the Switch, with its massive install base, is an opportunity to re-engage lapsed players, provide active players with another great hardware platform, and reach a new generation of players who will now discover the franchise on the Switch.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Atari:

RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic combines the best features from two of the original games in the series: RollerCoaster Tycoon and RollerCoaster Tycoon 2. Packed with content, players have enjoyed designing and building roller coasters and rides, landscaping and managing their parks since the first game was first introduced in 1999.

The release of RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic on Switch is the cherry on top of a busy year for the franchise. Atari kicked off a year-long celebration of the RollerCoaster Tycoon in March 2024 to honor the 25th Anniversary of Chris Sawyer’s visionary creation. Since that kick-off Atari has released a number of RollerCoaster Tycoon merchandize and apparel collabs, re-launched RCT Classic on Android, introduced major expansions to the mobile game RollerCoaster Tycoon Touch, and acquired RollerCoaster Tycoon 3 from Frontier to re-unite an important game with the franchise catalog.

Watch a new trailer below.

Switch Announce Trailer

item.title: Shenmue III publishing rights transferred to ININ Games
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/shenmue-iii-publishing-rights-transferred-to-inin-games

  • PC
  • PS4

"Keep an eye out for upcoming announcements as we unveil our vision for the next phase of Shenmue."

Publishing rights for Shenmue III have transferred from Deep Silver to ININ Games, developer YS NET and ININ Games announced.

Shenmue III first launched for PlayStation 4 and PC via Epic Games Store on November 19, 2019, followed by Steam and GOG exactly one year later.

“Following the previous collaboration on Air Twister, this will deepen the relationship with the legendary creator Yu Suzuki and his team,” reads the press release from ININ Games. “Known for our commitment to celebrating beloved titles and bringing them to new platforms, ININ Games is excited to shepherd Shenmue III into its next phase.

“This exciting transfer coincides with two momentous milestones: the 25th anniversary of the Shenmue series and the fifth anniversary of Shenmue III. Since its debut, Shenmue has captivated fans worldwide with its groundbreaking storytelling, immersive open-world gameplay, and its legacy as a pioneer in video game history. Shenmue III continues this tradition, keeping the spirit of the saga alive for a new generation of players.”

The press release continues, “We at ININ Games are honored to carry the Shenmue torch forward during such a significant moment in the series’ history. As we reflect on two decades of innovation and passion, we remain dedicated to preserving and sharing the journey of Ryo Hazuki with both long-time fans and newcomers.

“With this transfer, the story of Shenmue is far from over. We have exciting plans to celebrate these anniversaries, ensuring that this beloved series continues to thrive and inspire. Keep an eye out for upcoming announcements as we unveil our vision for the next phase of Shenmue‘s legacy.”

item.title: Mandragora launches April 17, 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/mandragora-launches-april-17-2025

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Pre-orders now available.

Side-scrolling dark fantasy action RPG Mandragora will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store on April 17, 2025, publisher Knights Peak and developer Primal Game Studio announced. 

The game will be available in the following editions:

  • Standard Edition
    • A copy of the game
    • Preview #1 access
    • Preview #2 access (early 2025)
    • Pre-order armor cosmetic set
    • Pre-order pet follower
    • Additional quest
  • Digital Deluxe Edition
    • All pre-order benefits, including both playable previews
    • Deluxe armor cosmetic set
    • Deluxe pet Follower
    • Digital orchestral original soundtrack
    • Digital art book
  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Knights Peak:

About

In Mandragora, mankind has surrendered the world to monsters. The people of Faelduum hide behind walls of brick and palisades of ignorance, constructed by their leaders. Players will journey through a world in decline, slowly succumbing to the damaging effects of Entropy. They will fight vicious creatures, challenge nightmarish bosses, meet new allies and enemies, and make harsh moral choices. The game offers many paths worth taking, each with its own unique challenges and rewards.

Mandragora is an action RPG game where players wield powerful weapons and magic, unravel secrets, battle nightmarish creatures, and shape the fate of their world. Developed by Primal Game Studio, it invites players into a dark medieval fantasy world where magic and danger collide.

Key Features

  • Six character classes with unique talent trees, passive skills, and over 200 active skill upgrades.
  • Face off against fearsome foes including 15 brutal Bosses and 19 challenging Mini Bosses.
  • Narrative crafted by Brian Mitsoda including alternate endings forged by the player.
  • Soundtrack composed by Christos Antoniou (Septicflesh) and performed by the FILMharmonic Orchestra of Prague.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Release Date Trailer

(Editor’s Note: While the trailer does not feature a Switch logo, a Primal Game Studio representative told Gematsu that Mandragora is planned for a simultaneous release on all supported platforms, including Switch.)

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 11/11/24 – 11/17/24
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/famitsu-sales-11-11-24-11-17-24

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake debuts at 821,770 retail sales.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of November 11, 2024 to November 17, 2024.

Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake was the highest-selling new release of the week, opening at 641,195 units on Switch and 180,575 units on PlayStation 5 for an opening week total of 821,770 retail copies sold.

On the hardware side, the Switch family sold 62,158 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 23,672 units, the Xbox Series family sold 3,070 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 35 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [NSW] Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 11/14/24) – 641,195 (New)
  2. [PS5] Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 11/14/24) – 180,575 (New)
  3. [NSW] Super Mario Party Jamboree (Nintendo, 10/17/24) – 32,762 (442,593)
  4. [NSW] Mario & Luigi: Brothership (Nintendo, 11/07/24) – 15,168 (78,609)
  5. [NSW] Beyblade X: XONE (FuRyu, 11/14/24) – 9,507 (New)
  6. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 5,784 (7,954,332)
  7. [NSW] Mario Kart 8 Deluxe (Nintendo, 04/28/17) – 5,647 (6,055,931)
